solution_line_template: A minute is {seconds_per_minute} seconds, so {minutes_to_convert} minutes is {minutes_to_convert} * {seconds_per_minute} = <<{minutes_to_convert}*{seconds_per_minute}={total_seconds}>>{total_seconds} seconds.
A hand-crank sharpener can sharpen {total_seconds} / {hand_crank_time_per_pencil} = <<{total_seconds}/{hand_crank_time_per_pencil}={pencils_hand_crank}>>{pencils_hand_crank} pencils in 6 minutes.
An electric sharpener can sharpen {total_seconds} / {electric_time_per_pencil} = <<{total_seconds}/{electric_time_per_pencil}={pencils_electric}>>{pencils_electric} pencils in 6 minutes.

Therefore, an electric sharpener can sharpen {pencils_electric} - {pencils_hand_crank} = <<{pencils_electric}-{pencils_hand_crank}={difference_in_pencils}>>{difference_in_pencils} more pencils than a hand-crank in 6 minutes.
